HTMLAttributesRelPrerender.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The prerender keyword for the rel attribute of the link element is a hint to browsers that the user might need the target resource for the next navigation, and therefore the browser can likely improve the user experience by preemptively fetching and processing the resource â€” for example, by fetching its subresources or performing some rendering in the background offscreen.

remarks.para: This feature is superceded by the Speculation Rules API.
-Speculative loading for a comparison of <link rel="prerender"> and other similar performance improvement features.
